skillTree.localised_description: Lord Daith has a lot of experience with different weapons and as such is deadly with any weapon, be it hammer, sword or halberd.

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.

skillTree.localised_description: Elven hunters emulate Kurnous, the God of the Hunt. Their speed and swiftness is therefore without peer.
A ranger should give no reprieve to the foe. Arrows must fall like a deluge, as deadly as lightning.
Lord Daith is always tinkering, naming these tweaks "enhancements" - most do improve whatever contraption he is working on.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -20% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction time: -50% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Forged by the blind priests of the Elven God of Smiths, and imbued with his skill and shrewdness, the hammer crushes all it touches.

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +20% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Enemy leadership: -8 when enemy lays siege or encircles
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: The Lord charges their troops to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.
Waystalkers’ keen eyes can spot an enemy at a distance that defies belief, and so they demand the same of their troops.
Once consumed by Loec’s aspect, one can instinctively evade attack through trickery, mimicking his deception of the Dark Gods.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Possessed by the Trickster God"

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Forge of Starlight is the domain of makers and craftsmen, of the artisans and smiths who create all Athel Loren’s many tools of wonder and war.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5
	(armies in local owned region)

skillTree.localised_description: Daith is blind, and has been so as long as any have known him, but none of this slows his craftsmanship at the forge. He performs his works by touch, and by the way hot metal changes the taste of the air. Nor does his lack of vision still his tongue, which is just as fiery as his forge.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Some whisper that Daith is older even than Ariel and Orion, that he fled Ulthuan with the first colonists; others claim that it was he who forged Aenarion’s Dragon armour. For such to be true, Daith would have to be many thousands of years old — something that would be considered near-impossible in any realm other than timeless Athel Loren.

A hunter is nothing without a quiver of reliable arrows. Usually the skilled archers of the Glade Guard fashion their own arrows, but they might make an exception with the arrows that comes out of Forge of Starlight.

effects.description:
Missile damage: +12% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -30% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.
When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark – when they do, the forest’s infinite anger is truly felt.

skillTree.localised_description: Let each bolt be imbued with the strength of Kurnous, and bring death to all his enemies.

skillTree.localised_description: Let the enemy feel the fury of nature, embodied in these warriors as they crash through their lines.

skillTree.localised_description: The warrior strikes with the strength of a swinging tree limb; few can stand against such strength.

skillTree.localised_description: Centuries upon centuries of existence have given these ancient Tree Spirits a natural armour, mitigating any physical blows dealt against them.

skillTree.localised_description: Not all of the forest's guardians are rooted to the ground – flying enemies will always be in danger from the woodland's airborne protectors.

skillTree.localised_description: Armour as hard as the ancient bark of the forest, it repels blows that would rend others asunder.

skillTree.localised_description: What is a ranger without an arrow? Who can be the best without dozens?

skillTree.localised_description: Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.

skillTree.localised_description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.
Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.
The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.
The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.
The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.
From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in them…

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.
A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.

factionEffects.localised_description: Torgovann, the Forge of Starlight, is a High Realm of Athel Loren, ruled by Lord Daith. The Forge of Starlight is the domain of makers and craftsmen, of the artisans and smiths who create all Athel Loren’s many tools of wonder and war.

effects.description: This faction is not yet finished. Meaning not everything will work as intended. You have been warned.
Diplomatic relations: +30 with High Elves and Wood Elf Realms

items.colour_text: Said to have been crafted by Daith himself, this armour binds the lifeforce of its bearer to that of Athel Loren, keeping them safe from harm.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +20%

items.colour_text: Kragg is the oldest and by far the most powerful living Runesmith - a gnarled old Dwarf, strong and enduring as a weather-beaten oak.

effects.description: Kragg the Grim will become available for recruitment.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Lord Daith, most celebrated of all the Elven smiths, is the master of Torgovann, and has been for as long as any Elf can recall.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2
	(armies in local owned region)
Army ability: "Vaul's Hammer" during siege battles
